item.title: Eurozone Economy Contracts Further, PMIs Suggest
item.description: The Eurozone composite PMI, which gauges activity in the manufacturing and services sectors, fell to an eight-month low of 48.9 in July, undershooting expectations.

item.title: Royal Philips Faces Uncertainty Despite 2023 Guidance Upgrade, 2Q Performance
item.description: Philips’s 2023 guidance upgrade looks conservative given its second-quarter performance, which is likely to raise some questions, Citi said, which rates the stock neutral with a €19 target price.

item.title: Oil Ticks Lower Ahead of Fed, ECB Meetings
item.description: Oil prices remained lower in Europe in a possible technical retreat following last week’s rally, with investors looking ahead to this week’s Fed and ECB meetings.

item.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Fall After Weak French PMI Data
item.description: Eurozone government bond yields fell, reversing rises in earlier trading, after French PMIs came in weaker than expected.

item.title: Dollar Could Get Boost From Fed Decision This Week, Market Positioning
item.description: The dollar could get a boost from Wednesday’s Fed decision, where it looks “too early” for policymakers to switch to a data-dependent approach, ING said.

item.title: Stellantis, Samsung SDI Team Up Again in US
item.description: Stellantis has signed a deal with Samsung SDI to build a second battery factory in the U.S. to begin manufacturing in early 2027.

item.title: Philips Targets Upgrade Fails to Impress
item.description: Philips posted earnings of €681 million in the second and said it expected an adjusted Ebitda margin at the upper end of the high-single-digit range for 2023, but the upgrade disappointed some analysts.

item.title: Vodafone Service Revenue Improves, Keeps Outlook
item.description: Vodafone reported group service revenue growth of 3.7% in the first quarter and reiterated its fiscal 2024 earnings guidance.

item.title: Chinese Money Flees the Western World
item.description: Chinese investors who once bought New York City hotels and other Western assets are placing their money elsewhere, including Indonesia’s nickel industry.

item.title: KPN Confirms Outlook After Profits Beat
item.description: KPN reported second-quarter adjusted earnings of €596 million and a 16% rise in net income and reaffirmed its guidance for the year.

item.title: Ryanair Tops Forecasts But Cuts Traffic Guidance
item.description: Ryanair posted a net profit of €663 million for the first quarter but cautioned that traffic for fiscal 2024 is expected to be lower than previous guidance due to Boeing delivery delays.

item.title: Julius Baer Reports Solid Earnings, Assets Growth
item.description: Julius Baer reported a 9% rise in first-half operating income and assets under management of CHF441 billion and said net new money intake had accelerated in the last two months of the second quarter, but that inflows continued to be affected by client deleveraging.

item.title: China Dominates Solar. Does the U.S. Stand a Chance?
item.description: The U.S. invented solar panels in the 1950’s. But it’s China that’s grown to dominate the technology in global markets. The WSJ examines the power dynamics in the industry, and whether the U.S. can reclaim its pioneering role.

item.title: Cleaning Up ChatGPT's Language Takes Heavy Toll on Human Workers
item.description: Contractors in Kenya say they were traumatized by effort to screen out descriptions of violence and sexual abuse during run-up to OpenAI’s hit chatbot.

item.title: Twitter chief Elon Musk said in a series of tweets that the social-media company would soon switch its longtime logo, the silhouette of a blue bird, to an "X."
item.description: Twitter chief Elon Musk said in a series of tweets that the social-media company would soon switch its longtime logo, the silhouette of a blue bird, to an “X.”

item.title: In Australia, the U.S. and its allies began a major two-week biennial military training exercise that officials say is the most expansive in the drill's history.
item.description: In Australia, the U.S. and its allies began a major two-week biennial military training exercise that officials say is the most expansive in the drill’s history.

item.title: Russia notched a victory in the fight for influence over global oil markets in recent days when the price of the country's most coveted crude traded above a Western price cap imposed to starve Moscow of funds for the war in Ukraine.
item.description: Russia notched a victory in the fight for influence over global oil markets in recent days when the price of the country’s most coveted crude traded above a Western price cap imposed to starve Moscow of funds for the war in Ukraine.

item.title: A U.N.-led team of expertswas set to beginan audacious operation to transfer to a safe place more than 1 million barrels of crude oil from a deteriorating tanker stranded off Yemen since 2015.
item.description: A U.N.-led team of experts was set to begin an audacious operation to transfer to a safe place more than 1 million barrels of crude oil from a deteriorating tanker stranded off Yemen since 2015.

item.title: Americans between the ages of 25 and 54 are either employed or looking for jobs at rates not seen in two decades, a trend helping to counter the exodus of older baby boomers from the workforce.
item.description: Americans between the ages of 25 and 54 are either employed or looking for jobs at rates not seen in two decades, a trend helping to counter the exodus of older baby boomers from the workforce.

item.title: Big fund managers that specialize in distressed investing are snapping up battered shares of real-estate investment trusts, historically the province of mom-and-pop investors.
item.description: Big fund managers that specialize in distressed investing are snapping up battered shares of real-estate investment trusts, historically the province of mom-and-pop investors.
